cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 44 (Tuesday, March 12, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. PFLUGER:H.R. 7640.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8The single subject of this legislation is:To prohibit the hiring of individuals who are not citizensof the United States to administer an election for Federaloffice in a State or local jurisdiction, and for otherpurposes.[Page H1149]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

bill.title: No Foreign Persons Administering Our Elections Act

item.title: No Foreign Persons Administering Our Elections Act
No Foreign Persons Administering Our Elections Act
To prohibit the hiring of individuals who are not citizens of the United States to administer an election for Federal office in a State or local jurisdiction, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
